https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Heritage conservation seeks to sustain the values of heritage (including both natural and cultural heritage) landscapes, places and objects, individually and collectively, so that the community and visitors can continue to appreciate, experience and learn from them and about them, and so that they can be passed on to future generations. More specifically, this field refers to the more practical or applied aspects of site or object restoration, preventative activities, and/or remedial treatments.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Adapted from the Fields of Research vocabulary from the Australian and New Zealand Standard Research Classification (ANZSRC, 2020). Definition adapted from New South Wales Heritage Office's 'Interpreting Heritage places and items: guidelines'.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Heritage conservation seeks to sustain the values of heritage (including both natural and cultural heritage) landscapes, places and objects, individually and collectively, so that the community and visitors can continue to appreciate, experience and learn from them and about them, and so that they can be passed on to future generations.
